meanings.definition: A member of a group of English Protestants in the 16th and 17th centuries who sought to simplify and regulate forms of worship.
meanings.sent1: The puritans gathered for prayer in the small chapel.
meanings.sent2: The puritans believed in a simple way of worship.
meanings.sent3: The puritans decided to have a potluck after their prayer meeting.
meanings.sent4: The puritans' devotion to their beliefs was as strong as a towering oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The image of the puritans kneeling in prayer was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A person who is strict in moral or religious matters, often to the point of being austere or self-righteous.
meanings.sent1: She was known in the community as a puritans for her strict adherence to moral values.
meanings.sent2: The puritans in the village disapproved of any form of entertainment.
meanings.sent3: The puritans refused to attend the costume party, citing moral reasons.
meanings.sent4: His puritans attitude towards life cast a shadow over his relationships.
meanings.sent5: The puritans' judgmental glares made her feel uncomfortable.
